ygData.subject: Re: the road less traveled...
ygData.msgSnippet: Mistmoore and Cazic are prime examples of when you have to learn to take the punishment with multiple mobs. One heal and they say who is that there..yum yum
ygData.messageBody:
Mistmoore and Cazic are prime examples of when you have to learn to take the
punishment with multiple mobs. One heal and they say who is that there..yum
yum and that can be whether plenty of dam done by your party or spcin those
heals or whatever..

And re taking the fall that was one of the places I died a bit on occasion
my fav tactic was pull the critters and say run as I hit divine a or b and
woops...still was normally sowed and gave them a head start to get the
hellout by gate or leggit, just depended how far i could get as to whether
my hits would last; the times I would normally die were when well deep and
was a gate and hope but then if I was saving 2 or more then i counted it a
worthwhile sacrifice, but did get a scolding for doing it but then they
realised they had better get out as I had done it and it was too late..again
MM was one of those places that evn though I had Div up they still kept
houndin me for some reason those inkies hated me reallll bad....
----- Original Message -----
From: Anne Falbo-Ortiz <topaaz_ladyjay@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, September 19, 1999 10:19 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] the road less traveled...


> From: "Anne Falbo-Ortiz" <topaaz_ladyjay@...>
>
> Mik i agree 100% with you, i was not debateing what you said, i was simply
> stateing how i do it. Furthermore, i melee alot but i choose to do it
when
> i am Oom, i have died on many occations, when i was oom and ordered my
group
> to flee, as i was full HP i stayed to get the critters of the rest of my
> group. IMHO i beleive that any cleric worth their salt will give up their
> life to save the group as a whole, LOL don't get me wrong tho, i don't
like-
> try to die, heh, and i am not saying this is the right way to go for all
> clerics, it is just the way i play the role, most often i do not die tho
and
> lvl right along with the rest of my group. i have been blessed with a
great
> group when we have more than one on us, and i am being hit, i usually just
> have to say "rook on me" and they are by my side, taunting or whatever,
and
> the only reason i ever lose anyone is if i am being hit and interuppted,
> that part od it sucks, but alas we do have another cleric in group who
> mainly does melee, so if i fail on a heal she can usually get my back,,,,,
> thats all :)
>
>
